Key Match Events: Charith Asalanka is the Player of the Match.
Sri Lanka posted 234/5 in 31.5 overs to win by 5 wickets over West Indies' 185/4 in 38.3 overs.
Sherfane Rutherford and Roston Chase were batting well until the rain interrupted play.
Kamindu Mendis and Janith Liyanage added close to 150 runs for the fifth wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: Charith Asalanka admitted the plan was to attack and be positive with the bat and that it got easier to bat once the ball got wet.
Shai Hope said they canâ€™t control the weather and the conditions but hopes to be better next time.
Sri Lanka won by 5 wickets by DLS method with 31 deliveries to spare.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was nicely poised when Sherfane Rutherford and Roston Chase were batting.
West Indies began brilliantly with the ball but struggled with the old ball.
The weather affected the game, leading to a rain-hit match with a truncated 37 overs.
